features.given: A manual recruitment process is in place at the college
features.when: The Campus Recruitment System is utilized
features.then: The overall recruitment process for the college should be optimized

features.given: Applicants have registered their qualifications and companies have specified their requirements within the system
features.when: A company performs a search for suitable candidates
features.then: The system should sort qualified applicants based on their qualifications and the company's requirements

features.given: Applicants have registered their skills and areas of interest within the system
features.when: The system analyzes applicant profiles
features.then: The system should predict suitable companies or placement opportunities for the applicant based on their skills and areas of interest

features.given: A student from the college wishes to participate in the recruitment process
features.when: The student interacts with the Campus Recruitment System
features.then: The student should be able to register and communicate with the placement office

features.given: A user (student or company) does not have an account in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The user attempts to create a new account
features.then: The system should allow the user to create an account and display a successful message

features.given: A registered user (student, company, or admin) has an existing account in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The user attempts to log in with their credentials
features.then: The system should authenticate the user, log them in, display a successful message, and provide utilities relevant to their role

features.given: A student is logged into their account in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The student searches for and views available job postings
features.then: The student should be able to successfully apply for a chosen job post

features.given: A student is logged into their account in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The student navigates to their profile or settings
features.then: The student should be able to update their personal details and change their password

features.given: A company is logged into their account in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The company accesses their job management features
features.then: The company should be able to post new jobs and update the details of existing available jobs

features.given: A company is logged into their account and has active job postings in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The company views a specific job posting
features.then: The company should be able to view the number of candidates who have applied for that job

features.given: An admin is logged into their account in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The admin reviews student accounts and activities
features.then: The admin should be able to validate student accounts and remove students if any discrepancy is found

features.given: An admin is logged into their account in the Campus Recruitment System
features.when: The admin accesses the system management features
features.then: The admin should be able to manage all activities related to both students and companies within the system

features.given: A user (admin, student, or company) has an existing account.
features.when: The user attempts to log in with valid credentials.
features.then: The login is successful, and the user gains access to the system.

features.given: A user (admin, student, or company) is currently logged in.
features.when: The user performs a logout action.
features.then: The user is successfully logged out of the system.

features.given: A user (admin, student, or company) is logged in.
features.when: The user updates their personal or account details.
features.then: Their details are successfully updated and reflected in their profile.

features.given: A user (admin, student, or company) is logged in and has an existing password.
features.when: The user changes their password.
features.then: The user's password is successfully reset/updated.

features.given: An admin is logged in and at least one company exists in the system.
features.when: The admin performs management actions on a company (e.g., validation, status update).
features.then: The company's status is updated as per admin's action, and it can continue with its account.

features.given: An admin is logged in and at least one student exists in the system.
features.when: The admin performs management actions on a student (e.g., validation, status update).
features.then: The student's status is updated as per admin's action, and they can continue with their account.

features.given: A student is logged in, an eligible job is posted by a company, and the student meets the job's eligibility criteria.
features.when: The student applies for the job.
features.then: The student successfully applies for the job and awaits a response from the company.

features.given: A student is logged in and has successfully applied for a job.
features.when: The student views their job application status.
features.then: The student sees the job status and can accept the job if selected, or apply for other jobs if not.

features.given: A student has an account and is logged in.
features.when: The student searches for jobs using various criteria.
features.then: The system displays available jobs matching the criteria, or indicates that no jobs are found.

features.given: A company has an account and is logged in.
features.when: The company posts a new job.
features.then: The job is successfully posted and is available for students to apply.

features.given: A company is logged in and at least one student has applied for one of its jobs.
features.when: The company views the applications submitted by students.
features.then: The company can see the student applications and react to them (e.g., shortlist, reject).

features.given: A user (admin, student, or company) needs assistance with logging in.
features.when: The user accesses the help feature for login.
features.then: The user receives guidance that enables them to log in.

features.given: The Campus Recruitment System requires persistent storage for structured data.
features.when: Data such as contact information needs to be saved or retrieved.
features.then: SQLite will be used as the primary database for the Android application.

features.given: A user installs the Campus Recruitment System application.
features.when: The application is launched on an Android device.
features.then: The application must be fully functional on Android systems running version 5.1 or greater.

features.given: The Campus Recruitment System is established on Android.
features.when: The system expands its platform support.
features.then: The system will also be made available for iOS mobiles, PCs, and Laptops.

features.given: A company posts a vacancy on the Campus Recruitment System portal.
features.when: Multiple students of the same specialty attempt to apply for the same vacancy.
features.then: A workflow system shall be designed to prevent duplicate applications from students of the same specialty and appropriately route vacancy requests.

features.given: The Campus Recruitment System stores accumulated user and company data.
features.when: The system's data storage requirements are assessed.
features.then: The system must be capable of storing a maximum of 64GB of data.

features.given: A student is navigating company selections and interview preparations.
features.when: The student seeks guidance on required skills and company eligibility.
features.then: A machine learning algorithm shall predict relevant skills and eligibility, continuously improving its accuracy by training on historical data.

features.given: An administrator manages the Campus Recruitment System database.
features.when: A student account remains inactive (no login) for one year.
features.then: The inactive student's data shall be archived to a parallel database.

features.given: A user opens the Android application for the first time
features.when: The application launches
features.then: The user is presented with the login screen

features.given: A user is on the login screen
features.when: The user has not registered and chooses to sign up
features.then: The user is redirected to the sign-up page

features.given: A student successfully creates an account
features.when: The student logs in with their credentials
features.then: The student gains access to the application and can apply for jobs

features.given: A company wants to use the system
features.when: The company signs up for an account and then attempts to log in
features.then: The company is able to successfully log in

features.given: An administrator wants to manage the system
features.when: The administrator accesses the web portal and logs in
features.then: The administrator can administer the system by managing students and companies

features.given: A student has successfully logged into the application
features.when: The main application interface is displayed
features.then: The student sees a side menu for navigation

features.given: A company has successfully logged into the application
features.when: The main application interface is displayed
features.then: The company sees a side menu for navigation

features.given: An administrator has successfully logged into the web portal
features.when: The main administrative interface is displayed
features.then: The administrator sees a side menu for navigation

features.given: A company is logged in
features.when: The company selects the option to add jobs
features.then: The company can add vacancies for their company

features.given: A user is logged in and sees the side menu
features.when: The user selects a particular section
features.then: The user can perform the respective task

features.given: A student has already submitted 30 application forms for jobs at a specific company
features.when: The student attempts to submit an application for an additional job at the same company
features.then: The system prevents the student from submitting the application

features.given: A user performs an action that results in an error
features.when: An error condition is triggered
features.then: An error message appears as a popup on the screen, with a maximum size of 40 characters

features.given: A student attempts to register with an ID that already exists in the system
features.when: The student submits the registration form
features.then: The system rejects the registration and informs the student that the ID is already taken

features.given: A company attempts to register with an ID that already exists in the system
features.when: The company submits the registration form
features.then: The system rejects the registration and informs the company that the ID is already taken

features.given: A user is on the sign-up page
features.when: The user provides valid student registration details and submits the form
features.then: A new student account is created, and the student is successfully registered

features.given: A user is on the sign-up page
features.when: The user provides valid company registration details and submits the form
features.then: A new company account is created, and the company is successfully registered

features.given: A user is on the sign-up page
features.when: The user provides valid admin registration details and submits the form
features.then: A new admin account is created, and the admin is successfully registered

features.given: A registered user (student, company, or admin) is on the login page
features.when: The user enters valid credentials and submits
features.then: The user is successfully logged in and directed to their respective dashboard

features.given: A user is on the login page
features.when: The user enters invalid credentials and submits
features.then: An appropriate error message is displayed, and the user remains on the login page

features.given: A student user is logged in
features.when: The student navigates to their profile, updates their information, and saves changes
features.then: The student's profile information is successfully updated in the system

features.given: A user (student, company, or admin) is logged in
features.when: The user navigates to the change password section, enters current and new passwords, and submits
features.then: The user's password is successfully updated

features.given: A company user is logged in
features.when: The company user navigates to the job posting section, provides valid job details, and submits
features.then: A new job is successfully posted and becomes visible to students

features.given: A student user is logged in and views available jobs
features.when: The student selects a job and initiates the application process
features.then: The student's application for the selected job is recorded in the system

features.given: A student user is logged in and has applied for jobs
features.when: The student navigates to their job applications section
features.then: The student can view the status of their applied jobs

features.given: A student user is logged in
features.when: The student uses the search functionality with specific keywords or filters
features.then: A list of jobs matching the search criteria is displayed

features.given: An admin user is logged in
features.when: The admin navigates to the 'Manage Student' section and performs an action (e.g., view, edit, delete)
features.then: The selected action on the student record is successfully performed

features.given: An admin user is logged in
features.when: The admin navigates to the 'Manage Company' section and performs an action (e.g., view, edit, delete)
features.then: The selected action on the company record is successfully performed

features.given: A company user is logged in and has posted jobs
features.when: The company user navigates to the 'View Applications' section for one of their posted jobs
features.then: The company user can view all applications submitted by students for that job

features.given: A company user is logged in and viewing student applications for a job
features.when: The company user selects a student application and initiates the 'Call for Interview' action
features.then: The selected student is notified of the interview call, and the application status is updated accordingly

features.given: A user attempts to access a protected page (e.g., admin dashboard, another user's private data)
features.when: The user is not authenticated or not authorized for that specific page
features.then: The system denies access and either prompts for login or displays an 'access denied' message

features.given: A user is on any form requiring input (e.g., registration, job posting)
features.when: The user submits the form with invalid or missing required data
features.then: The system displays specific error messages for the invalid fields, preventing form submission

features.given: A user from an institution other than National Institute of Technology, Surathkal, Karnataka
features.when: They attempt to access the system
features.then: Access to the system should be denied.

features.given: A user affiliated with National Institute of Technology, Surathkal, Karnataka
features.when: They attempt to access the system
features.then: They should be presented with a login screen requiring a user-id and password.

features.given: A user provides a valid login-id and password
features.when: They attempt to log in
features.then: They should be successfully granted access to the system.

features.given: A student has already accepted a recruitment offer from one company
features.when: Another company attempts to recruit the same student
features.then: The system should prevent the student from being recruited by the second company.

features.given: A company has officially selected a candidate
features.when: The company attempts to reject the selected candidate
features.then: The system should prevent the rejection and mark the company as blacklisted.

features.given: A student already has an active account in the system
features.when: The same student attempts to create an additional account
features.then: The system should prevent the creation of a duplicate account for that student.

features.given: An invalid action is performed by a user
features.when: The system encounters an error
features.then: A descriptive and easily understandable error message should be displayed to the user.
